seo.title: Positano travel tips for first‑time visitors
seo.description: Essential tips on getting there, etiquette, packing, and avoiding common pitfalls — with hostel‑friendly advice.

linkLabel: Positano travel tips for first‑time visitors
intro: First time in Positano? These tips cover arrivals, luggage, payments, and staying connected without stress.

sections.title: Arrive smart
body: Pre-book train + bus or ferry legs when possible; the first departures of the morning beat heat and queues.
Heavy luggage? Pair the SITA bus to Chiesa Nuova with a porter from the dock so the steepest stairs are handled for you.

sections.title: Luggage & stairs
body: Pack light with soft-sided bags or backpacks that handle narrow staircases and shuttle trunks.
Arriving early? Use luggage storage along Via dei Mulini so you can explore hands-free until check-in.

sections.title: Timing & reservations
body: Plan beach time and big walks before 10:00 or after 16:00 when lanes are cooler and transport is calmer.
Book restaurants, boat tours, and Path of the Gods shuttles at least a day ahead in high season.

sections.title: Payments & cash
body: Cards are widely accepted, but many cafés and tabacchi set minimum spends—keep €5–€10 notes on hand.
ATMs work but fees vary; withdraw medium amounts once and split cash between pockets.

sections.title: Connectivity & backups
body: Pick up an Italian eSIM (TIM/Vodafone) or confirm roaming; coverage is best higher up the hill.
Download offline maps, ferry schedules, and hostel directions for the times mobile data dips.

tips: Save offline copies of bus/ferry timetables and hostel arrival instructions for moments without signal.
Carry a refillable bottle (750 ml / 25 oz) and a light layer—days are hot, evenings breezy above the beach.

faqs.q: Can I manage with carry-on only?
a: Yes—pack quick-dry outfits, plan to use the hostel laundry, and bring travel-size toiletries to stay within airline limits.

faqs.q: Do I need a power adapter?
a: Italy uses 230V Type F/L sockets; bring a universal adapter if your plugs differ from the EU standard.
